content.description: The crux comes in the last 15 feet, via thin, steep, face moves. Save something for the upper crux moves. This is probably the best warm-up on Sunrise Wall.
content.location:
This route climbs the sheer face right of

Sunset

crack, the trad line.

content.description: The crux comes 10 feet off the ground after placing the first #1 stopper, and reaching fixed pin, the rest is steep and sustained.
content.protection: Small wires to #4, fixed Lost-Arrow piton, small Camalots to a #1, a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Follow the beautiful crack system right of

Sunrise

.

content.description: The crux comes past second bolt, but the climbing remains steep and pumping.
content.location: This is located on a nice section in middle of the Sea Cliff.

content.description: The crux comes at the top after the 6th bolt. It involves stretchy layaways to break.
content.protection:
6 bolts to 2 bolt belay as for

Sunrise

route.
content.location:
This is located on Sunrise Wall between

Sunrise

and

Sunset

.

content.description: This follows a prominent hand crack.
content.protection: 2/2.5/3 cams protect hand crack to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: It is located on left end of Sends Wall, right of Sunrise Wall.

content.description: The crux comes after the 2nd clip utilizing the arete and laybacks.
content.location: The route is located on the smaller cliff on the right, north side of the larger faces, right of Sunrise Wall.

content.description: The crux involves intricate face moves after clipping and moving past the 3rd bolt. There is a crimpy high step roll-over.
content.location:
Start as for

Moon Scape

, then immediately move right via underclinging and lay backing. Climb straight up middle of face moving gradually to the right.

content.description: This is at a high point in crack on left, undercling out right and onto main face.
content.location: This is located on the prominent, sheer, south most section of the Sea Cliff. Start at a face and hand crack, then move [right] onto face.

content.description: The crux is enduring the first 15 feet of steep, intricate, layback climbing.
content.location:
The route starts right of

Moon Walk

in layback system then eventually it merges with

Moon Walk's

halfway point.

content.description: The crux involves two sections, first reaching from hand crack onto face and moving up and right to jug, then moving up the face, 5 feet above the jug to the next break.  You can move straight up the face which is very reachy or move left which is more crimpy but less reachy.
content.location:
Located left of

Sunrise

route, follow a left-leaning hand crack for about 10-15 feet and then move right onto steep face then straight up wall.
